concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Getting started

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Device layout and functions

section.p: ▶ Galaxy A34 5G:
▶ Galaxy A54 5G:

ul.li: When using the speakers, such as when playing media files or using speakerphone, do not place the device close to your ears.

Be careful not to expose the camera lens to a strong light source, such as direct sunlight. If the camera lens is exposed to a strong light source, such as direct sunlight, the camera image sensor may be damaged. A damaged image sensor is irreparable and will cause dots or spots in pictures.
If you use the device with its glass or acrylic body broken, there may be a risk of injury. Use the device only after it has been repaired at a Samsung Service Centre or an authorised service centre.

If dust or foreign materials enter the microphone, speaker, or receiver, or if these parts are covered, the device’s sound may become quiet or certain features may not work. If you attempt to remove the dust or foreign materials with a sharp object, the device may be damaged and its appearance may be affected.

li.p: Connectivity problems and battery drain may occur in the following situations:

ul.li: If you attach metallic stickers on the antenna area of the device
If you attach a device cover made with metallic material to the device
If you cover the device’s antenna area with your hands or other objects while using certain features, such as calls or the mobile data connection
If the air vent hole is covered by an accessory, such as a protective film or sticker, unwanted noises may occur during calls or media playback.
Do not cover the light sensor area with accessories, such as stickers or a cover. Doing so may cause the sensor to malfunction.

reference.domains: (topic reference) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
reference.title: Hard keys

ul.li: When the device is off, press and hold to turn it on.
Press to turn on or lock the screen.
Press and hold to start a conversation with Bixby. Refer to Using Bixby for more information.
Press twice or press and hold to open the app or feature you set.
Press simultaneously to capture a screenshot.
Press and hold simultaneously to turn off the device.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Setting the Side key

abstract.p: Select an app or feature to launch by pressing the Side key twice or pressing and holding the Side key.

step.cmd: Open Settings, tap Advanced features ~~ Side key, and then select an option you want.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Soft buttons

section.p: When you turn on the screen, the soft buttons will appear at the bottom of the screen. Refer to Navigation bar (soft buttons) for more information.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Charging the battery

section.p: Charge the battery before using it for the first time or when it has been unused for extended periods.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Wired charging

section.p: Connect the USB cable to the USB power adapter and plug the cable into the device’s multipurpose jack to charge the battery. After fully charging, disconnect the charger from the device.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Quick charging

abstract.p: Use a super fast charger or fast charger.

step.cmd: You can check the connection status of the charger by opening Settings and tapping Battery and device care ~~ Battery.

ul.li: If fast charging does not work, open Settings, tap Battery and device care ~~ Battery ~~ More battery settings, and then check if the feature you want is turned on. Also, check if the USB cable and the USB power adapter are connected properly.
You can charge the battery more quickly while the device or its screen is turned off.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Charging other devices

section.p: Use the USB cable to charge another mobile device with your phone’s battery.
Connect your phone and the other device using your phone’s USB cable. A USB connector may be needed depending on the other device.
When charging starts, the battery charging icon will appear on the other device’s screen.
section.note: The app selection pop-up window that appears on your phone is for data transfer. Do not select an app from the pop-up window.

reference.domains: (topic reference) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
reference.title: Reducing the battery consumption

abstract.p: Your device provides various options that help you conserve battery power.

ul.li: Optimise the device using the device care feature.
When you are not using the device, turn off the screen by pressing the Side key.
Turn on power saving mode.
Close unnecessary apps.
Turn off the Bluetooth feature when not in use.
Turn off auto-syncing of apps that need to be synced.
Decrease the backlight time.
Decrease the screen brightness.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Battery charging tips and precautions

section.note: Use only Samsung-approved battery, charger, and cable specifically designed for your device. Incompatible battery, charger, and cable can cause serious injuries or damage to your device.

ul.li: Connecting the charger improperly may cause serious damage to the device. Any damage caused by misuse is not covered by the warranty.
Use only USB Type-C cable supplied with the device. The device may be damaged if you use Micro USB cable.
If you charge the device while the multipurpose jack is wet, the device may be damaged. Thoroughly dry the multipurpose jack before charging the device.

To save energy, unplug the charger when not in use. The charger does not have a power switch, so you must unplug the charger from the electric socket when not in use to avoid wasting power. The charger should remain close to the electric socket and easily accessible while charging.
When using a charger, it is recommended to use an approved charger that guarantees the charging performance.
If the battery is completely discharged, the device cannot be turned on immediately when the charger is connected. Allow a depleted battery to charge for a few minutes before turning on the device.

If you use multiple apps at once, network apps, or apps that need a connection to another device, the battery will drain quickly. To avoid losing power during a data transfer, always use these apps after fully charging the battery.
Using a power source other than the charger, such as a computer, may result in a slower charging speed because of a lower electric current.
The device can be used while it is charging, but it may take longer to fully charge the battery.
If the device receives an unstable power supply while charging, the touch screen may not function. If this happens, unplug the charger from the device.

While charging, the device and the charger may heat up. This is normal and should not affect the device’s lifespan or performance. If the battery gets hotter than usual, the charger may stop charging.
If the device is not charging properly, take the device and the charger to a Samsung Service Centre or an authorised service centre.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Nano-SIM card and eSIM

section.p: Insert the SIM or USIM card provided by your carrier.

To have two phone numbers or carriers for a single device, activate the eSIM or insert two SIM cards. Differing from a physical nano-SIM card, an eSIM is an embedded digital SIM. Using both the nano-SIM card and the eSIM may result in slower data transfer speeds in some areas.

ul.li: eSIM may not be available depending on the region, carrier, or model.
Some services that require a network connection may not be available depending on the carrier.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Inserting the SIM or USIM card

abstract.p: ▶ Galaxy A34 5G:
▶ Galaxy A54 5G:

step.cmd: Insert the ejection pin into the hole on the tray to loosen the tray.
Pull out the tray gently from the tray slot.
▶ Galaxy A34 5G: Place the SIM or USIM card on the tray with the gold-coloured contacts facing downwards and gently press the SIM or USIM card into the tray to secure it.

info.p: ▶ Galaxy A54 5G: Place the SIM or USIM card on the tray with the gold-coloured contacts facing upwards and gently press the SIM or USIM card into the tray to secure it.

step.cmd: Insert the tray back into the tray slot.

ul.li: Use only a nano-SIM card.
Use caution not to lose or let others use the SIM or USIM card. Samsung is not responsible for any damages or inconveniences caused by lost or stolen cards.
Ensure that the ejection pin is perpendicular to the hole. Otherwise, the device may be damaged.
If the card is not fixed firmly into the tray, the SIM card may leave or fall out of the tray.
If you insert the tray into your device while the tray is wet, your device may be damaged. Always make sure the tray is dry.
Fully insert the tray into the tray slot to prevent liquid from entering your device.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Correct card insertion (dual SIM card tray)

section.p: ▶ Galaxy A34 5G:
▶ Galaxy A54 5G:

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Activating an eSIM

step.cmd: Open Settings and tap Connections ~~ SIM manager ~~ Add eSIM. When a mobile plan is found, follow the on-screen instructions to activate the eSIM.

info.p: If you have a QR code provided by your carrier, open Settings, tap Connections ~~ SIM manager ~~ Add eSIM ~~ Scan QR code from service provider, and then scan the QR code.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: SIM manager (dual SIM models)

step.cmd: Open Settings and tap Connections ~~ SIM manager.

ul.li: SIM cards: Activate the SIM card to use and customise the SIM card settings.
eSIMs: Activate the eSIM.
Preferred SIMs: Select to use specific SIM cards for some features, such as voice calls, when two cards are activated.

li.p: Data switching: Set the device to use another SIM card for data services if the preferred SIM card cannot connect to the network.
li.note: You may incur additional charges when using this feature.

ul.li: More SIM settings: Customise the call or eSIM settings.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: microSD card

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Inserting an SD card

abstract.p: Your device’s SD card capacity may vary from other models and some SD cards may not be compatible with your device depending on the SD card manufacturer and type. To check out your device’s maximum SD card capacity, refer to the Samsung website.
▶ Galaxy A34 5G:
▶ Galaxy A54 5G:

step.cmd: Insert the ejection pin into the hole on the tray to loosen the tray.
Pull out the tray gently from the tray slot.
▶ Galaxy A34 5G: Place an SD card on the tray with the gold-coloured contacts facing downwards and gently press the SD card into the tray to secure it.

info.p: ▶ Galaxy A54 5G: Place an SD card on the tray with the gold-coloured contacts facing upwards and gently press the SD card into the tray to secure it.

step.cmd: Insert the tray back into the tray slot.

ul.li: Use only a microSD card.
Some SD cards may not be fully compatible with the device. Using an incompatible card may damage the device, the SD card, or the data stored in it.
Use caution to insert the SD card right-side up.
Ensure that the ejection pin is perpendicular to the hole. Otherwise, the device may be damaged.
When you remove the tray from the device, the mobile data connection will be disabled.
If the card is not fixed firmly into the tray, the SD card may leave or fall out of the tray.
If you insert the tray into your device while the tray is wet, your device may be damaged. Always make sure the tray is dry.
Fully insert the tray into the tray slot to prevent liquid from entering your device.

The device supports the FAT and the exFAT file systems for SD cards. When inserting a card formatted in a different file system, the device will ask to reformat the card or will not recognise the card. To use the SD card, you must format it. If your device cannot format or recognise the SD card, contact the SD card manufacturer, a Samsung Service Centre or an authorised service centre.
Frequent writing and erasing of data shortens the lifespan of SD cards.
When inserting an SD card into the device, the SD card’s file directory appears in the My Files ~~ SD card folder.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Removing the SD card

abstract.p: Before removing the SD card, first unmount it for safe removal.

step.cmd: Open Settings and tap Battery and device care ~~ Storage.
Swipe to the left to access the SD card page.
Tap ~~ Unmount.

result.note: Do not remove external storage, such as an SD card or USB storage, while the device is transferring or accessing information, or right after transferring data. Doing so can cause data to be damaged or lost or cause damage to the external storage or phone. Samsung is not responsible for losses, including loss of data, resulting from the misuse of external storage devices.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Formatting the SD card

abstract.p: An SD card formatted on a computer may not be compatible with the device. Format the SD card on the device.

step.cmd: Open Settings and tap Battery and device care ~~ Storage.
Swipe to the left to access the SD card page.
Tap ~~ Format.

result.note: Before formatting the SD card, remember to make backup copies of all important data stored in the SD card. The manufacturer’s warranty does not cover loss of data resulting from user actions.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Turning the device on and off

section.note: Follow all posted warnings and directions from authorised personnel in areas where the use of wireless devices is restricted, such as aeroplanes and hospitals.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Turning the device on

section.p: Press and hold the Side key for a few seconds to turn on the device.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Turning the device off

step.cmd: To turn off the device, press and hold the Side key and the Volume Down key simultaneously. Alternatively, open the notification panel, swipe downwards, and then tap .
Tap Power off.

info.p: To restart the device, tap Restart.

result.note: You can set the device to turn off when you press and hold the Side key. Open Settings, tap Advanced features ~~ Side key, and then tap Power off menu under Press and hold.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Forcing restart

section.p: If your device is frozen and unresponsive, press and hold the Side key and the Volume Down key simultaneously for more than 7 seconds to restart it.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)

abstract.p: You can make an emergency call or check the medical information you saved.

step.cmd: Press and hold the Side key and the Volume Down key simultaneously, and then tap Emergency call. Alternatively, open the notification panel, swipe downwards, and then tap ~~ Emergency call.

result.note: To manage your medical information and emergency contacts, open Settings and tap Safety and emergency.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Initial setup

section.p: When you turn on your device for the first time or after performing a data reset, follow the on-screen instructions to set up your device.
section.note: If you do not connect to a Wi-Fi network, you might not be able to set up some device features during the initial setup.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)

abstract.p: Using the Samsung account, you can use a variety of Samsung services that are provided through mobile devices, TVs, and the Samsung website.
To check the list of services that can be used with your Samsung account, visit .

step.cmd: Open Settings and tap Samsung account.

info.p: Alternatively, open Settings and tap Accounts and backup ~~ Manage accounts ~~ Add account ~~ Samsung account.

step.cmd: Sign in to your Samsung account. If you do not have a Samsung account, tap Create account.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Finding your ID and resetting your password

step.cmd: If you forget your Samsung account ID or password, tap Find ID or Forgot password? on the Samsung account sign-in screen. You can find your ID or reset your password after you enter the required information.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Signing out of your Samsung account

abstract.p: When you sign out of your Samsung account, your data, such as contacts or events, will also be removed from your device.

step.cmd: Open Settings and tap Accounts and backup ~~ Manage accounts.
Tap Samsung account ~~ My profile and tap Sign out at the bottom of the screen.
Tap Sign out, enter your Samsung account password, and then tap OK.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Transferring data from your previous device (Smart Switch)

abstract.p: You can use Smart Switch to transfer data from your previous device to your new phone.

step.cmd: Open Settings and tap Accounts and backup ~~ Bring data from old device.

ul.li: This feature may not be supported on some devices or computers.
Limitations apply. Visit for details. Samsung takes copyright seriously. Only transfer content that you own or have the right to transfer.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Transferring data using a USB cable

abstract.p: You can connect your previous device to your new phone with the USB cable to transfer data.

step.cmd: Connect your new phone and the previous device using your new phone’s USB cable.

info.p: A USB connector may be needed depending on the previous device.

step.cmd: When the app selection pop-up window appears, tap Smart Switch ~~ Receive data.
In the previous device, tap OK.

info.p: If you do not have the app, download it from Galaxy Store or Play Store.
Your new phone will recognise the previous device and a list of data you can transfer will appear.

step.cmd: On your new phone, select an option you want, tap Next, and then follow the on-screen instructions to transfer data.

result.note: Do not disconnect the USB cable from the device when you are transferring files. Doing so may cause data loss or device damage.

Transferring data increases the battery power consumption of your device. Ensure that your device is sufficiently charged before transferring data. If the battery power is low, data transfer may be interrupted.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Transferring data wirelessly

abstract.p: Transfer data from your previous device to your new phone wirelessly through Wi-Fi Direct.

step.cmd: On the previous device, open Smart Switch.

info.p: If you do not have the app, download it from Galaxy Store or Play Store.

step.cmd: On your new phone, open Settings and tap Accounts and backup ~~ Bring data from old device.
Place the devices near each other.
On the previous device, tap Send data ~~ Wireless.
On your new phone, tap Receive data, select your previous device’s operating system, and then tap Wireless.
On the previous device, tap Allow.
On your new phone, select an option you want, tap Next, and then follow the on-screen instructions to transfer data.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Backing up and restoring data using external storage

abstract.p: Transfer data using external storage, such as a microSD card.

step.cmd: Back up data from your previous device to external storage.
Insert or connect the external storage device to your phone.
On your phone, open Settings and tap Accounts and backup ~~ External storage transfer.
Select the backup date under Restore from SD card.
Select an option you want, tap Next, and then follow the on-screen instructions to transfer data.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Transferring backup data from a computer

abstract.p: Back up data from your previous device to a computer and import the data to your new phone.

step.cmd: On the computer, visit to download Smart Switch.
On the computer, open Smart Switch.

info.note: If your previous device is not a Samsung device, back up data to a computer using an app provided by the device’s manufacturer. Then, skip to the fifth step.

step.cmd: Connect your previous device to the computer using the device’s USB cable.
On the computer, follow the on-screen instructions to back up data from the device.

info.p: Then, disconnect your previous device from the computer.

step.cmd: Connect your new phone to the computer using the USB cable.
On the computer, follow the on-screen instructions to transfer data to your new phone.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Understanding the screen

reference.domains: (topic reference) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
reference.title: Controlling the touch screen

entry.p: Touch and hold the screen for approximately 2 seconds.
Touch and hold an item and drag it to the target position.
Swipe upwards, downwards, to the left, or to the right.
Spread two fingers apart or pinch on the screen.

ul.li: Do not allow the touch screen to come into contact with other electrical devices. Electrostatic discharges can cause the touch screen to malfunction.
To avoid damaging the touch screen, do not tap it with anything sharp or apply excessive pressure to it with your fingertips or other object.
It is recommended not to use fixed graphics on part or all of the touch screen for extended periods. Doing so may result in afterimages (screen burn-in) or ghosting.

section.note: The device may not recognise touch inputs close to the edges of the screen, which are outside of the touch input area.

reference.domains: (topic reference) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
reference.title: Navigation bar (soft buttons)

abstract.p: When you turn on the screen, the soft buttons will appear on the navigation bar at the bottom of the screen. The soft buttons are set to the Recents button, Home button, and Back button by default. The functions of the buttons can change according to the app currently being used or usage environment.

ul.li: Tap to open the list of recent apps.
Tap to return to the Home screen.
Touch and hold to open the Google Assistant app.
Tap to return to the previous screen.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Hiding the navigation bar

abstract.p: Check files or use apps on a wider screen by hiding the navigation bar.

step.cmd: Open Settings, tap Display ~~ Navigation bar, and then tap Swipe gestures under Navigation type. The navigation bar will be hidden and the gesture hints will appear. Tap More options and select an option you want.

result.p: If you want to hide the gesture hints at the bottom of the screen, tap the Gesture hint switch to turn it off.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Home screen and Apps screen

section.p: The Home screen is the starting point for accessing all of the device’s features. It displays widgets, shortcuts to apps, and more.
The Apps screen displays icons for all apps, including newly installed apps.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Switching between Home and Apps screens

section.p: On the Home screen, swipe upwards to open the Apps screen.
To return to the Home screen, swipe upwards or downwards on the Apps screen. Alternatively, tap the Home button or the Back button.

If you add the Apps button on the Home screen, you can open the Apps screen by tapping the button. On the Home screen, touch and hold an empty area, tap Settings, and then tap the Show Apps screen button on Home screen switch to turn it on. The Apps button will be added at the bottom of the Home screen.

reference.domains: (topic reference) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
reference.title: Editing the Home screen

abstract.p: On the Home screen, touch and hold an empty area, or pinch your fingers together to access the editing options. You can set the wallpaper, add widgets, and more. You can also add, delete, or rearrange Home screen panels.

ul.li: Adding panels: Swipe to the left, and then tap .
Moving panels: Drag a panel preview to a new location.
Deleting panels: Tap on the panel.
Wallpaper and style: Change the wallpaper settings for the Home screen and the locked screen.
Themes: Change the device’s theme. Visual elements of interface, such as colours, icons, and wallpapers, will change depending on the selected theme.

Widgets: Widgets are small apps that launch specific app features to provide information and convenient access on your Home screen. Select a widget and tap Add. The widget will be added on the Home screen.
Settings: Configure settings for the Home screen, such as the screen layout.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Displaying all apps on the Home screen

step.cmd: Without using a separate Apps screen, you can set the device to display all apps on the Home screen. On the Home screen, touch and hold an empty area, and then tap Settings ~~ Home screen layout ~~ Home screen only ~~ Apply.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Launching Finder

abstract.p: Search for content on the device.

step.cmd: On the Apps screen, tap Search. Alternatively, open the notification panel, swipe downwards, and then tap .
Enter a keyword.

info.p: Apps and content on your device will be searched.
If you tap on the keyboard, you can search for more content.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Moving items

abstract.p: Drag an item to a new location. To move the item to another panel, drag it to the side of the screen.

step.cmd: To add a shortcut to an app on the Home screen, touch and hold an item on the Apps screen, and then tap Add to Home. A shortcut to the app will be added on the Home screen.

info.p: You can also move frequently used apps to the shortcuts area at the bottom of the Home screen.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Creating folders

abstract.p: On the Home screen or the Apps screen, drag an app over another app.

step.cmd: A new folder containing the selected apps will be created. Tap Folder name and enter a folder name.

li.p: Tap on the folder. Tick the apps to add and tap Done. You can also add an app by dragging it to the folder.
Drag an app to a new location.
Touch and hold a folder, and then tap Delete folder. Only the folder will be deleted. The folder’s apps will be relocated to the Apps screen.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Edge panel

abstract.p: You can access your favourite apps and features from the Edge panels.
Drag the Edge panel handle towards the centre of the screen.

step.cmd: If the Edge panel handle is not visible, open Settings, tap Display, and then tap the Edge panels switch to turn it on.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Lock screen

section.p: Pressing the Side key turns off the screen and locks it. Also, the screen turns off and automatically locks if the device is not used for a specified period.
To unlock the screen, swipe in any direction when the screen turns on.
If the screen is off, press the Side key to turn on the screen. Alternatively, double tap the screen.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Changing the screen lock method

step.cmd: To change the screen lock method, open Settings, tap Lock screen ~~ Screen lock type, and then select a method.

info.p: When you set a pattern, PIN, password, or your biometric data for the screen lock method, you can protect your personal information by preventing others from accessing your device. After setting the screen lock method, the device will require an unlock code whenever unlocking it.

result.note: You can set your device to perform a factory data reset if you enter the unlock code incorrectly several times in a row and reach the attempt limit. Open Settings, tap Lock screen ~~ Secure lock settings, unlock the screen using the preset screen lock method, and then tap the Auto factory reset switch to turn it on.

reference.domains: (topic reference) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
reference.title: Indicator icons

abstract.p: Indicator icons appear on the status bar at the top of the screen. The icons listed in the table are most common.

entry.p: LTE network connected in LTE network that includes the 5G network

ul.li: The status bar may not appear at the top of the screen in some apps. To display the status bar, drag down from the top of the screen.
Some indicator icons appear only when you open the notification panel.
The indicator icons may appear differently depending on the carrier or model.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Notification panel

section.p: When you receive new notifications, indicator icons appear on the status bar. To check out more information about the icons, open the notification panel and check the details.
To open the notification panel, drag the status bar downwards. To close the notification panel, swipe upwards on the screen.
You can use the following functions on the notification panel.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Using quick setting buttons

step.cmd: Tap quick setting buttons to turn on certain features. Swipe downwards on the notification panel to access more buttons. To add more buttons, tap .

result.p: To change feature settings, tap the text under each button. To access more detailed settings, touch and hold a button.
To rearrange buttons, tap ~~ Edit buttons, drag a button to another location.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Controlling media playback

abstract.p: Control media on your phone and connected nearby devices on the notification panel.

step.cmd: Open the notification panel and tap Media output.
Tap the icons on the controller to control the playback.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Controlling nearby devices

abstract.p: Launch and take control of nearby connected devices and frequently used SmartThings devices and scenes on the notification panel.

step.cmd: Open the notification panel and tap Device control.

info.p: Nearby connected devices and SmartThings devices and scenes will appear.

step.cmd: Select a nearby device or a SmartThings device to control it, or select a scene to launch it.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Screen capture and screen record

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Screen capture

section.p: Capture a screenshot while using the device and write on, draw on, crop, or share the captured screen. You can capture the current screen and scrollable area.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: How to capture a screenshot

step.cmd: Use the following methods to capture a screenshot. You can check the captured screenshots in Gallery.

info.p: Method 1) Key capture: Press the Side key and the Volume Down key simultaneously.
Method 2) Swipe capture: With the edge of your hand, swipe your hand to the left or right across the screen.

ul.li: It is not possible to capture a screenshot while using some apps and features.
If capturing a screenshot by swiping is not turned on, open Settings, tap Advanced features ~~ Motions and gestures, and then tap the Palm swipe to capture switch to turn it on.

result.p: After capturing a screenshot, use the following options on the toolbar at the bottom of the screen:

ul.li: : Capture the current content and the hidden content on an elongated page, such as a webpage. When you tap , the screen will automatically scroll down and more content will be captured.
: Write or draw on the screenshot or crop a portion from the screenshot. You can check the cropped area in Gallery.
: Add tags to the screenshot. To search for screenshots by tag, tap in Gallery. You can access the tags list and search for the screenshot you want.
: Share the screenshot with others.

result.note: If the options are not visible on the captured screen, open Settings, tap Advanced features ~~ Screenshots and screen recorder, and then tap the Show toolbar after capturing switch to turn it on.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Screen record

abstract.p: Record the screen while using your device.

step.cmd: Open the notification panel, swipe downwards, and then tap (Screen recorder).
Select a sound setting and tap Start recording.

info.p: After a countdown, recording will start.

ul.li: To write or draw on the screen, tap .
To record the screen with a video overlay of yourself, tap .

step.cmd: When you are finished recording the video, tap .

info.p: You can check the video in Gallery.

result.note: To change the screen recorder settings, open Settings and tap Advanced features ~~ Screenshots and screen recorder.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Entering text

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Keyboard layout

section.p: A keyboard appears automatically when you enter text.
section.note: Text entry is not supported in some languages. To enter text, you must change the input language to one of the supported languages.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Changing the input language

step.cmd: Tap ~~ Languages and types ~~ Manage input languages and select the languages to use. When you select two or more languages, you can switch between the input languages by tapping .

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Changing the keyboard

step.cmd: On the navigation bar, tap to change the keyboard.

info.p: To change the keyboard type, tap ~~ Languages and types, select a language, and then select the keyboard type you want.

ul.li: If the keyboard button () does not appear on the navigation bar, open Settings, tap General management ~~ Keyboard list and default, and then tap the Keyboard button on navigation bar switch to turn it on.
On a 3 x 4 keyboard, a key has three or four characters. To enter a character, tap the corresponding key repeatedly until the desired character appears.

reference.domains: (topic reference) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
reference.title: Additional keyboard functions

ul.li: : Enter emojis, stickers, and more. You can also enter your emoji stickers that look like you. Refer to Using your AR emoji stickers in chats for more information.
: Add an item from the clipboard.
: Switch to one-handed operation mode.
: Enter text by voice.
: Change the keyboard settings.

section.p: Tap to use more keyboard functions.

ul.li: : Switch to the split keyboard.
: Switch to the floating keyboard. You can move the keyboard to another location by dragging the tab.
: Search for content and enter it.
: Translate text and enter it.
: Recognise text from documents or images and enter it.
: Enter your personal information registered to Samsung Pass.
: Find spelling and grammatical mistakes and get suggestions when writing in English.
: Share music links.
: Share video links.
: Enter emojis.
: Attach GIFs.
/ / : Enter stickers.
: Change the keyboard size.
: Open the text editing panel.

section.note: Some features may not be available depending on the carrier or model.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Copying and pasting

step.cmd: Touch and hold over text.
Drag or to select the desired text, or tap Select all to select all text.
Tap Copy or Cut.

info.p: The selected text is copied to the clipboard.

step.cmd: Touch and hold where the text is to be inserted and tap Paste.

info.p: To paste text that you have previously copied, tap Clipboard and select the text.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Using your AR emoji stickers in chats

abstract.p: You can use your emoji stickers during a conversation through messages or on a social network. The following actions are an example of using your emoji stickers in the Messages app.

step.cmd: While composing a message in the Messages app, tap on the Samsung keyboard.
Tap the emoji icon.
Select one of your emoji stickers.

info.p: The emoji sticker will be inserted.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Using Bixby

abstract.p: While pressing and holding the Side key, say what you want to Bixby. Alternatively, say the wake-up phrase and say what you want.
For example, while pressing and holding the Side key, say “How’s the weather today?” The weather information will appear on the screen.

step.cmd: If Bixby asks you a question during a conversation, you can continue to talk to Bixby without pressing the Side key or tapping .
